result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court in custody at Brown County Jail.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Roberto Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:47 AM Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Roberto Rodriguez.  Attorney Dana Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lopez recently appointed and had an opportunity to speak with his client in court today.  Attorney Lopez does not beleive competency is an issue.  Present bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:51 AM Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Kim Hardtke in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lopez will take the cases, however unable to jump on zoom this morning.  Competency was not addressed at todays hearing.  Bail/bond will be argued at next hearing.
